column4: hey all.. I have a fresh install of ubutun 11.0 and by default it's starting the default window manager. How do I disable this? I dont want any WM running at all. Just a root prompt. I thought it was gdm, but there are no init scripts for that
add the boot option: text
you will be able to log in as your user at CLI and use your OS as usual there
thanks. Where do I add that?
#ubuntu+1
sorry?
the channel for Precise is #ubuntu+1
thanks. I'll ask there too. Unless you just wanna tell me the file name? :)
file name of what?
I assume to edit the boot option so I can add : text to it. I just dont want the WM to run at boot
gksudo gedit /etc/default/grub
thank you!
So just add "text" to the GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet splash" line in /etc/default/grub file?
or do I just uncomment GRUB_TERMINAL=console ?
adding the boot option is the way I know, not sure about GRUB_TERMINAL
ok so add it to the GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT?
the line that says:  quiet splash     add the option in the quotes
then save and close the file and run:  sudo update-grub
thanks again man
hrmm, I did that and the update-grub call and now it's just hanging at startup after "checking battery state"... grrr
So I had to not use "text" but remove "splash" and then do "echo 'manual' > /etc/init/lightdm.override" and that did the job
sweet, I'm guessing you ran: sudo -i   first, or the echo command would fail
thanks again for the help!
